result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony T Erby

records.addlTxt:
JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  

Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report dated 10-20-2022; Received, filed and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Anthony T Erby in court.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Anthony T Erby.  Attorney William T. Berens in court for State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for sentencing, however state advises not having victim notification and requests adjournment. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.
Notice of Motion to Adjourn.

Defendant Anthony T Erby in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 2.  

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 1 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defendant is advised is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  
Defendant is advised unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  

Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 4.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant Anthony T Erby in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Chad Wozniak and Anthony T Erby appeared by video means. Defense is requesting a written offer to provide to defendant. Case is adjourned in Branch 04.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant Anthony T Erby in court (via zoom) with attorney James Edgar Toran (in person).  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case in court for scheduling conference. Discovery and offer received. Defense requests projected guilty plea date. Court sets additional status date. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.
Branch 4 down on 5-11-2022. Parties contacted to reschedule hearing. Parties agree upon new court date. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD.

Defendant Anthony T Erby in court with Attorney James Edgar Toran; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 04, Judge Hanrahan. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated March 25, 2022 - received
22RM015269  Actual Date Bond Posted with *sheriff 03/17/2022

Court ordered no contact with Darrell D.E.; Makel L.J.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Adjustment Number: 22A 026424,
Payable Number: 993436,
Receipt Number: 22RP011107,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Anthony T Erby in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Anthony T Erby in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony T Erby appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
